summary: This is a domestic witness travel request form from the SDNY Victim/Witness Unit, dated November 11, 2021, for an unnamed fact witness to travel to appear at the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell on December 1, 2021. The witness is scheduled to arrive on December 1 and depart on December 3, 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the travel request form (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell).

persons.name: Ed Tyrrell
persons.context: Mentioned in the form's instructions as a contact for questions regarding witness travel funding for investigative interviews.

events.title: Witness Testimony at Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: An unnamed fact witness is scheduled to appear and testify at the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell in the SDNY.

keyFacts: A fact witness was scheduled to testify at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial on December 1, 2021, requiring a travel request from the SDNY Victim/Witness Unit.
The witness's identity is protected in this document; the name and DOB fields are blank, indicating the form was prepared for submission to a travel agency and TSA.
The witness was not classified as a victim-witness, a federal employee, or someone facing criminal charges.
The travel was approved for the specific purpose of court testimony, as per DOJ guidelines referenced in the form's instructions.
The document references DOJ Instruction 1300.01.01 and internal procedures for funding witness travel, highlighting the administrative process behind the trial.
